This project involves the analysis of wide-band millimeter wave propagation data collected over extended periods of time. Ideally this analysis would lead to millimeter wave propagation models that can be used in 5G deployment design.

About IPA

Innovations for Poverty Action (IPA) is a research and policy nonprofit that discovers and promotes effective solutions to global poverty problems. IPA brings together researchers and decision-makers to design
column11703: and refine these solutions and their applications
column11704: ensuring that the evidence created is used to improve the lives of the world’s poor. In recent decades
column11705: trillions of dollars have been spent on programs designed to reduce global poverty
column11706: but clear evidence on which programs succeed is rare
column11708: decision-makers often do not know about it. IPA exists to bring together leading researchers and these decision-makers to ensure that the evidence we create leads to tangible impact on the world. Since its founding in 2002
column11709: IPA has worked with over 575 leading academics to conduct over 650 evaluations in 51 countries. This research has informed hundreds of successful programs that now impact millions of individuals worldwide.'
